will also accept charters to or from Kasane.

Kasane is laid out along the south bank of the Chobe River, and the main road follows the river's course.  Thus the city is pretty linear.

There is not much public transport in Kasane.  Many destinations (between Chobe Safari Lodge and Mowana) are within 2km of each other, so you can get around well by foot.  If you need a ride, you are best off with your own vehicle. Or, your lodge or safari operator may offer a transfer.

value: just to the west.  It seems like every lodge offers game drives, so there are many to choose from. They typically last three hours to all day. There is a fee to enter the park, which may be included in the game drive fee.
are also possible. Be sure you have a proper 4x4 vehicle, proper gear, enough water and fuel, and campsite reservations for the park.

are also offered by many operators, likely including your lodge. They typically are 3 hours long, from about 3PM - 6PM, through the sunset.  Some cruises are in small boats which hold only six people; others are in large double-decker boats.

, 70 km away in Zimbabwe and Zambia, are offered by many operators. Expect P400-500 for an unguided trip. Allow an additional visa fee per person (US$30-55/adult depending on citizenship), US$20/person for Victoria Falls park entrance, and further money for lunch, activities, and shopping.

has a gift shop opposite its reception desk which offers maps (including the valuable Shell Map and Infomap of Botswana), field guides to birds and plants, plus T-shirts, carvings, and other souvenirs.

Many of the hotels have in-house dining rooms offering breakfast and dinner.

value: has a fine buffet dinner, with a total cost of about P200/person including drinks and tip.  It includes a selection of game meats, and Botswana specialties like pap and shredded beef.

also offers an outstanding buffet dinner, with game meat, and stir-fry cooked while you wait. Set in an open room overlooking the river, with outstanding service, it makes for a fine evening. About P180/person including drinks and tip.

The major hotels all have bars.

value: content=Five simple rooms, each with two twin beds. Friendly attitude. Near the airport. Meals available on request.
directions=A few km E of Kasane on the Francistown Road
content=Camping, basic chalets, and deluxe chalets (with a/c) all set on the banks of the Chobe. Game drives and river cruises offered.
price=single USD 130; double USD 170; triple USD 198
content=Riverside location, nicely decorated rooms, beautiful grounds.
price=Dinner bed & breakfast: single USD 305/person; double USD 210/person; ask about SADC discount
content=charming, rooms are well-furnished, has a garden. They offer either a dinner, bed, and breakfast option, or an all-inclusive option with some activities.
content=Charming design, with the rooms in a ring around a courtyard with fountain. Rooms have balconies that overlook the pool or the Chobe river. Clean, with friendly staff.
content=Built in concentric rings around a spectacular Mowana (baobab) tree, this is the top end of the hotels in town.
content=An exquisite location, recently remodeled with fine materials, and a price to match.
price=camping BWP 65, double BWP 780, family BWP 955
content=Great location next to the Chobe River. Some of the double rooms styled like traditional rondavel huts. Air conditioning, swimming pool.

content=This lodge also boasts river frontage with gorgeous river views, boating jetty, excellent dining, bar, curio shop, contemporary pool with poolside bar and family friendly poolside space. Staff are efficient and knowledgeable and the dramatic entrance area is a highlight of the Lodge.
directions=On the north side of the road, near the Post Office
content=Also offers phone calls and office services.  Charmingly, the sign in front translates offerings into Chinese and Japanese.
price=P15 for 1st 30 minute; P10 for every 30 minutes thereafter; no partial refunds for unused time.
content=Five computers with moderate-speed connection to North America. Also offers money change service.
